chapter.title: Long Term Preservation of Archival Data in Noark 5
chapter.para: The ultimate goal of Noark 5 standardization of archival data is longterm preservation and readable storage.

chapter.title: Problems
chapter.para: The following problems sometimes occur:

listitem.para: Government bodies such as Arkivverket publish archive standards such as Noark 5.
Vendors write scripts that sometimes are incompliant with standards and incompatible software and programming languages.

chapter.title: The Noark 5 Standard
chapter.para: The switch from DTD in Noark 4 to XSD in Noark 5 made the standard stronger, but still requires correct parsing of endpoints and implementation of the formal standard.
With Noark 5 large parts of the standard was tidied up.

chapter.title: Audience
chapter.para: Document Controllers and Record Keepers can point at Noark 5 for best practise.

chapter.title: Separation of Data and Structure with MVC

chapter.para: Thomas Sødring at Oslo Metropolitan University with assistance from Petter Reinholdtsen at University of Oslo implements a free Noark 5 Core.

chapter.title: HTTPD Configuration
chapter.para: Install Apache 2 and download the core from github.com in /var/www/html/
Configure Apache 2 in /etc/apache2/sites-available/000-default.conf
chapter.programlisting:
<VirtualHost www.arkivarium.com:80> ServerName www.arkivarium.com ServerAdmin webmaster@arkivarium.com DocumentRoot /var/www/html/nikita-noark5-core/web/ ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/www.arkivarium.com-error.log CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/www.arkivarium.com-access.log combined </VirtualHost>
<VirtualHost arkivarium.com:80> ServerName arkivarium.com ServerAdmin webmaster@arkivarium.com DocumentRoot /var/www/html/nikita-noark5-core/web/ ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/arkivarium.com-error.log CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/arkivarium.com-access.log combined RewriteEngine on RewriteCond %{SERVER_NAME} =arkivarium.com RewriteRule ^ https://%{SERVER_NAME}%{REQUEST_URI} [END,NE,R=permanent] </VirtualHost> s
chapter.para: Replace {www.}arkivarium.com with your own domain name and configure DNS settings.
Add DNS records on the name servers for your domain to the IP address of your web server.
Remember to replace the domain arkivarium.com and IP address 178.255.144.178 with the actual domain and IP address of your web server running Apache.
Enable HTTPD configuration in /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default.conf

Download certbot-auto from https://certbot.eff.org/ (see https://certbot.eff.org/#ubuntutyakkety-apache for instructions on Ubuntu 16.10) and run certbot --apache -d arkivarium.com (replace arkivarium.com with your domain). Install the certificates for arkivarium.com and add a redirect to https in certbot.
Restart the HTTPD configuration with service apache2 restart

chapter.title: Configuration of the free Noark 5 Core
chapter.para: Download the free Noark 5 core from github.com
Edit nikita-noark5-core/core-webapp/src/main/resources/application.yml with a text editor such as vim, Emacs or gedit by locating the settings.
vi /var/www/html/nikita-noark5-core/core-webapp/src/main/resources/application.yml
Modify the following and replace {www.}arkivarium.com with your domain name:
chapter.programlisting:
--- a/core-webapp/src/main/resources/application.yml +++ b/core-webapp/src/main/resources/application.yml @@ -38,7 +38,7 @@ info: app.name: OsloMet Noark 5 Core (Demo mode) build.version: ${project.version} hateoas: - publicAddress: http://localhost:8092/noark5v4 + publicAddress: http://www.arkivarium.com:8092/noark5v4
jwt: header: Authorization @@ -53,16 +53,16 @@ nikita-noark5-core: pagination: _maxPageSize: 10 mail: - from: nikita@example.com + from: webmaster@arkivarium.com metrics: # DropWizard Metrics configuration, used by MetricsConfiguration jmx.enabled: true spark: enabled: false - host: localhost + host: www.arkivarium.com port: 9999 graphite: enabled: false - host: localhost + host: www.arkivarium.com port: 2003 prefix: nikitaNoark5Core logs: # report metrics in the logs @@ -73,7 +73,7 @@ nikita-noark5-core: ROOT: DEBUG logstash: # Forward logs to logstash over a socket, used by LoggingConfiguration enabled: false - host: localhost + host: www.arkivarium.com

chapter.title: Configuration of the Web Interface
chapter.para: Download the free Noark 5 core from github.com
Edit nikita-noark5-core/web/dependencies/internal/config.js in a text editor such as vim, Emacs or gedit by locating the settings.
Modify the following:
chapter.programlisting: nikitaOptions = { baseUrl: 'http://localhost:8092/noark5v4/', guiBaseUrl: 'http://localhost:3000/', appUrl: 'http://localhost:8092/noark5v4/hateoas-api', fondsStructureRoot: 'http://localhost:8092/noark5v4/hateoas-api/arkivstruktur/', createFondsAddress: 'http://localhost:8092/noark5v4/hateoas-api/arkivstruktur/ny-arkiv', createFondsCreatorAddress: 'http://localhost:8092/noark5v4/hateoas-api/arkivstruktur/ny-arkivskaper', loginUrl: "http://localhost:8092/noark5v4/auth", protocol: 'http', appName: 'noark5v4', apiName: 'hateoas-api', authPoint: 'auth', displayFooterNote: true, displayBreadcrumb: true, enabled: true };
chapter.para: Launch the free Noark 5 Core in a seprate terminal with cd nikita-noark5-core; make
Launch the web Interface in a new terminal with cd nikita-noark5-core/web; make run
